snippet: The scale and longevity of a data storage program run by the government in partnership with AT&T was unmatched by other government programs, including the National Security Agency’s gathering of phone call logs.
abstract: Hemisphere Project, federal program that allowed counter-narcotics law enforcement officials to have routine access to enormous AT&T database containing records of Americans' phone calls, is far larger in scope than National Security Agency’s gathering of phone call logs; project comes to light at time of vigorous public debate over proper limits on government surveillance and on relationship between federal agencies and communications companies.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and COLIN MOYNIHAN

lead_paragraph: The scale and longevity of a data storage program run by the government in partnership with AT&T was unmatched by other government programs, including the National Security Agency’s gathering of phone call logs.

headline.main: Drug Agents Use Vast Phone Trove, Eclipsing N.S.A.’s
headline.print_headline: Drug Agents Use Vast Phone Trove, Eclipsing N.S.A.’s

keywords.value: White House Office of National Drug Control Policy
keywords.name: organizations
